intro: Senebiera australis, commonly known as the southern senebiera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom in the spring. Senebiera australis is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
